tasks: Create a simple wireframe of a login form using the 8-point grid system, focusing on proper alignment and spacing. (Reference: Law of Proximity, Tesler's Law) - Score Improvement: +3 UI Craft & Visual Design
Write a short paragraph explaining the Aesthetic-Usability Effect and its impact on design decisions. (Reference: Aesthetic-Usability Effect, lawsofux.com) - Score Improvement: +2 UX Fundamentals

Sketch 5 different navigation options for your portfolio using the 8-point grid system, considering the Law of Proximity. (Reference: Law of Proximity, Tesler's Law) - Score Improvement: +3 UI Craft & Visual Design

Create a low-fidelity sketch of a product feature that incorporates the concept of proximity and alignment. (Reference: Law of Proximity, Tesler's Law) - Score Improvement: +4 UI Craft & Visual Design

Conduct a solo user research exercise using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to identify pain points in your current design process. Document 3 insights. (Reference: User Research & Validation, lawsofux.com) - Score Improvement: +5 User Research & Validation

Write a short reflection on how you can apply the principles of UX Fundamentals to improve your collaboration and communication skills. (Reference: Collaboration & Communication, lawsofux.com) - Score Improvement: +3 Collaboration & Communication

Create a high-fidelity wireframe of a product feature that incorporates the concept of proximity and alignment, using the 8-point grid system. (Reference: Law of Proximity, Tesler's Law) - Score Improvement: +5 UI Craft & Visual Design

Develop a simple prototype of your portfolio navigation using InVision or Figma, incorporating the principles of UX Fundamentals. Share with a peer group for feedback. (Reference: Collaboration & Communication, lawsofux.com) - Score Improvement: +5 Collaboration & Communication

Write a short article explaining how you can apply the Aesthetic-Usability Effect to improve your design decisions. Publish on a personal blog or Medium. (Reference: Aesthetic-Usability Effect, lawsofux.com) - Score Improvement: +4 UX Fundamentals

Create an interactive prototype of your portfolio navigation using InVision or Figma, incorporating the principles of UX Fundamentals and user research insights. Share with a peer group for feedback. (Reference: Collaboration & Communication, lawsofux.com) - Score Improvement: +7 Collaboration & Communication

Develop a comprehensive design system document outlining the application of UX Fundamentals in your design process. Share with your team or mentor. (Reference: UX Fundamentals, lawsofux.com) - Score Improvement: +8 UI Craft & Visual Design

Conduct a peer review of 3 colleagues' designs using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design. Provide actionable feedback and score improvements. (Reference: UX Fundamentals, nngroup.com) - Score Improvement: +9 UX Fundamentals

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the unique opportunity to shape the user experience of innovative products and services. By leveraging your research skills and collaborating with cross-functional teams, you can drive meaningful design decisions that delight users and propel business success.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Tesler's Law and its Application in UX Design
topics.summary: Tesler's Law states that the most accessible information is the first piece of information on a screen, which is crucial for designers to consider when organizing content.
practice_points: Create 3 wireframes with clear and concise navigation menus, applying Tesler's Law to prioritize primary actions
Conduct 2 usability testing sessions to validate Tesler's Law in real-world scenarios
Analyze 5 existing websites that effectively apply Tesler's Law and identify best practices

topics.name: Applying the Aesthetic-Usability Effect in Visual Design
topics.summary: The Aesthetic-Usability Effect suggests that visually appealing designs are more usable, making it essential for designers to consider aesthetics when creating user interfaces.
practice_points: Design 3 visual design concepts using a consistent color palette and typography, applying the Aesthetic-Usability Effect
Conduct 2 user interviews to validate the impact of visual appeal on usability
Analyze 5 successful product designs that effectively balance aesthetics and functionality

topics.name: Mastering User Research using the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: The Jobs-to-be-Done framework helps designers understand users' motivations and behaviors, enabling them to create more effective solutions.
practice_points: Conduct 5 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and document findings
Create a personas document based on user research findings
Develop a user journey map illustrating the user's goals and pain points
